newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen sees computer output value of 17 bln yuan.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen sees computer output value of 17 bln yuan.

text.p: Southern China's Shenzhen expects computer output value to grow by 45 percent to 17 billion yuan for 1996 compared with 11.75 billion yuan in 1995, the Shenzhen Special Zone Daily said on Tuesday.
Shenzhen has become one of China's most thriving computer production bases in terms of production scale, technology and pace of growth, the newspaper said.
The city has more than 1,500 computer and parts makers, it said.
In 1995, Shenzhen turned out 205,000 PCs, 1.99 million hard drives and 333 million floppy disks, the newspaper said.
